required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Treatment of Advanced Gastrointestinal Tumors With Albumin Taxol
clinical_study.official_title: A Retrospective Clinical Study on the Efficacy and Safety of Injection Taxol (Albumin Binding Type) in the Treatment of Patients With Advanced Gastrointestinal Tumors

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study was to evaluate the safety and efficacy of domestic injection paclitaxel (albumin binding type) in patients with advanced digestive tract tumors,and to further explore the possible predictors of efficacy.In order to provide more effective chemotherapeutic drugs, prolong survival time and improve quality of life for patients with advanced digestive tract tumors.

primary_outcome.description: Progression free survival (PFS) is the time between the onset of treatment and the observation of disease progression or death from any cause.

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as the proportion of patients with a documented complete response, and partial response (CR+PR)
The Overall survival (OS) is defined as the date from random grouping to death from any cause.

intervention.description: 125mg/m2, d1, 8, intravenous infusion for 30min, 1 cycle every 3 weeks;Other combined chemotherapy drugs and drug doses shall be administered by clinicians according to the guidelines and the actual situation of clinical patients.

facility.name: Affiliated Cancer Hospital of Zhengzhou University & Henan Cancer Hospital
